ghost.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: the spirit of a dead person that some people think they can feel or see in a place
ghost.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: They say the young girl’s ghost still haunts (=often appears in) the house.
He looked as if he’d seen a ghost (=he looked very frightened).
the ghost of Old Tom Morris
ghost.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: the memory or effect of someone or something bad that lived, existed, or happened in the past
ghost.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: The ghost of Stalinism still affects life in Russia today.
ghost.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a second image that is not clear on a television or computer screen
ghost.translation[0].note_box[0].section: ghost
the spirit of a dead person that some people think they can feel or see in a place
His ghost is believed to haunt the house.
spirit
a creature without a physical body, such as an angel or ghost
evil spirits
the spirit world
apparition
an image of a dead person that someone sees suddenly for a short time
He claimed to have seen an apparition in the church.
poltergeist
a ghost that people cannot see, which throws things or moves things around
The house was haunted by a poltergeist that makes things move around all by themselves, sometimes quite big things like beds or wardrobes.
spook
a ghost
I’m not scared of spooks.
phantom
a frightening and unclear image of a dead person
They had seen phantoms gliding on the surface of the water.
spectre
a ghost, especially a frightening one
She had looked like a spectre.
The following night, the spectre appeared again.
ghost.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to write something as a ghost writer
ghost.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: people who are listed as workers on a company’s books and PAYROLL, but who do not do any work for the company
ghost.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: Some contractors, in the interest of labor harmony, hire ghosts.
Exhibitors complained that their bills are inflated byghost workers supposedly employed by the exhibition centre.
ghost.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: to write something as a GHOSTWRITER
ghost.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: She received a generous advance fee for the book she’s ghosting.
